alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 4:57PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, west central St. Tammany and southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes through 530 PM CST... At 456 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Ponchatoula, or 13 miles north of Laplace, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Covington, Madisonville and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 50 and 65. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 5 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist
